alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:55PM CDT until April 14 at 3:18PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Carlyle. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Carlyle. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.8 feet, Near this height, the left bank below the dam near the tailwater gage begins flooding. Minor flooding of park grounds begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 19.7 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling to below flood stage by late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun Kaskaskia River Carlyle 16.5 19.7 18.2 17.0 15.7 14.7 14.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
